alert.note: Alert for Bitterroot, Sapphire Mountains; Lower Clark Fork Region; Missoula, Bitterroot Valleys; Potomac, Seeley Lake Region (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 21 at 10:00AM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...A very heavy rain shower will impact portions of south central Missoula County through 1015 AM MDT... At 958 AM MDT, the public reported a very heavy rain shower over Lolo and Missoula, moving north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Visibility one-quarter mile or less. SOURCE...Public. IMPACT...Low visibility could result in dangerous driving conditions. Locations impacted include... Missoula, Lolo, Bonner-West Riverside, East Missoula, and Evaro. This includes the following highways... Interstate 90 between mile markers 97 and 112. Highway 93 N between mile markers 9 and 13. Highway 93 S between mile markers 83 and 94. Highway 200 E between mile markers 0 and 5. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is occurring with this shower and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Bitterroot, Sapphire Mountains; Lower Clark Fork Region; Missoula, Bitterroot Valleys; Potomac, Seeley Lake Region
